item.title: Wuthering Waves version 2.4 update ‘Lightly We Toss the Crown’ launches June 12
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/wuthering-waves-version-2-4-update-lightly-we-toss-the-crown-launches-june-12

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Smartphone

New main questlines, Echoes, Resonators, weapons, convenes, and more.

Kuro Games will release the version 2.4 update for free-to-play open-world action RPG Wuthering Waves, dubbed “Lightly We Toss the Crown,” on June 12, the developer announced.

Here is an overview of the update:

  • New Main Quest
    • Chapter II Act V – Shadow of Glory
    • Chapter II Act VI – Flames of Heart
  • Gifts of Grand Opening
    • Claim Radiant Tide x10 via in-game mail
  • New Outfits
    • Laurel Nymph
    • Changli – Deluxe Outfit
    • Splashing Summer
    • Carlotta – Deluxe Outfit
  • New Region
    • Septimont
  • New Echoes
    • Lioness of Glory
    • Nightmare: Kelpie
    • Kerasaur
    • Pilgrim’s Shell
    • Devotee’s Flesh
    • Spectro Drake
    • Fusion Drake
    • Havoc Drake
  • New Phantom Echoes
    • Phantom: Cuddle Wuddle
    • Phantom: Fae
    • Ignis
  • New Sonata Effects
    • Windward Pilgrimage
      • 2 Piece Set: Aero DMG + 10%
      • 5 Piece Set: Hitting a target with Aero Erosion increases Crit Rate by 10% and grants 30% Aero DMG Bonus, lasting for 10s.
    • Flaming Clawprint
      • 2 Piece Set: Fusion DMG +10%
      • 5 Piece Set: Casting Resonance Liberation increases Fusion DMG of Resonators in the team by 15% and the caster’s Resonance Liberation DMG by 20% lasting for 35 seconds.
  • New Echo Aspects
    • Premium Aspect: Dawn upon Thorns (Glide)
    • Premium Aspect: Dawn upon Thorns (Flight)
    • Exploration Aspect: Moment of Triumph (Flight)
    • Obtainable through Special Events
  • New Permanent Challenge Gameplay
    • Banners Never Fall
  • New Tactical Hologram Challenge
    • Tactical Hologram: Kelpie
  • Optimizations
    • In-game Guide Depot: Visit the in-game guide depot for information on how to build your Resonators and set up optimum team comps.
    • Focus Mode: Main quest focus mode will become available once Version 2.4 goes live. In focus mode, no Resonator or location will become unavailable as you progress through a quest.
    • Global Filter: Added the Global Filter feature for PC, PS5, and Mac. Select a filter that you prefer on the Global Filter page and adjust the intensity of the filter. Using the Global Filter feature allows you to adjust in-game visuals. Please note that cutscenes and UI elements will not be affected by the filter.
    • Main Quest Fast Track Event: Optimized the event “Next Stop: Rinascita.” After activating Jinzhou’s Resonance Nexus during Main Quest, you can go to Rinascita directly and start experiencing Version 2.0 content.
    • More Optimizations Coming: Stay tuned for more official announcements on updates and optimizations.
  • Lightly We Toss the Crown
    • New Resonators:
      • Cartethyia
      • Lupa
    • Upcoming Featured Resonator Convene
      • Phase I – Dance in the Storm’s Wake
      • Phase II – Roar of Triumph
    • New Weapons
      • Defier’s Thorn
      • Wildfire Mark
    • Upcoming Featured Weapon Convene
      • Phase I – Defier’s Thorn
      • Phase II – Wildfire Mark
    • Special Events:
      • The Everglorious Summit
      • Area Exploration Event
      • Septimont Travel Atlas
      • Featured Exploration Event
      • Uncovering Past Heroes
      • Photo Collection Event
      • Gifts of Applause
      • 7-Day Login Event
      • All Out! Towards the Peaks of Prestige
      • Echo Combat Event
      • Lollo Campaign: Verification
      • Featured Commission Event
      • Virtual Crisis: Frontier Trials
      • Crisis Trial Challenge Event

Wuthering Waves is available now for PlayStation 5, PC via client download and Epic Games Store, iOS via App Store, and Android via Google Play. The PC version will also be available via Steam starting April 29.

item.title: FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time – Switch 2 ‘Graphics’ and ‘Load Time’ trailers
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/fantasy-life-i-the-girl-who-steals-time-switch-2-graphics-and-load-time-trailers

  • Switch 2

A look at how the game performs on Switch 2.

Publisher LEVEL-5 and developer LEVEL-5 Osaka Office have released two new trailers for the Switch 2 version of FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time showcasing the game’s visual and load time improvements on the platform.

As previously announced, the Switch 2 version will launch on June 5 with enhanced graphics and smoother frame rates over the Switch version. Switch users will be able to upgrade to the Switch 2 version by purchasing the “Nintendo Switch 2 Edition Upgrade Pack” for $2.59 / €2.27 / 300 yen.

FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time is currently available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam.
